articles.title: On-Money Addition Fails Without Corroborative Evidence
articles.summary: The issue was whether a seized loose paper alone can justify an on-money addition under section 69. ITAT held that without independent corroboration, such addition cannot be sustained. The post On-Money Addition Fails Without Corroborative Evidence appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Adjudication Beyond SCN: Violation of Section 75(7) of CGST Act, 2017
articles.summary: The law mandates strict adherence to the notice’s grounds and amounts. Any enhancement or new basis at adjudication violates natural justice and the CGST Act. The post Adjudication Beyond SCN: Violation of Section 75(7) of CGST Act, 2017 appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Consequences of Cancellation of Re‑Registration under Section 12AB – Why Charitable Trusts Cannot Afford to Ignore It
articles.summary: Expanded grounds for cancellation now include legal non-compliance and incorrect disclosures. Trusts must treat accuracy and governance as mission-critical. The post Consequences of Cancellation of Re‑Registration under Section 12AB – Why Charitable Trusts Cannot Afford to Ignore It appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Practical Guidance: Key Points to Keep in Mind While Replying to Notices under Section 12AB
articles.summary: Objects benefiting specific communities or allowing overseas application of funds invite rejection. The ruling focus is on deed language, not intent. The post Practical Guidance: Key Points to Keep in Mind While Replying to Notices under Section 12AB appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Incorrect E-Form Filing Attracts Penalty Even If Later Rectified: MCA
articles.summary: The order clarifies that filing an incorrect statutory e-form attracts penalties even if the mistake is later admitted and rectified. Administrative correction does not erase the original contravention under the Companies Act. The post Incorrect E-Form Filing Attracts Penalty Even If Later Rectified: MCA appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Wrong Shareholding Disclosure in Annual Return – MCA imposes Penalty
articles.summary: The adjudication confirms that incorrect classification of promoter and public shareholding in statutory filings attracts penalties. Even inadvertent errors in Form MGT-7 trigger liability under the Companies Act. The post Wrong Shareholding Disclosure in Annual Return   MCA imposes Penalty appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Company Penalised for Wrong Board Meeting Dates in Statutory Returns
articles.summary: The adjudicating authority ruled that filing statutory e-forms with incorrect particulars constitutes a completed violation. Subsequent requests to mark forms defective do not erase penalty liability. The post Company Penalised for Wrong Board Meeting Dates in Statutory Returns appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Wrong AGM Date in Annual Filing- MCA Imposes Penalty
articles.summary: An incorrect AGM date disclosed in an annual return led to penal action. The ruling clarifies that accuracy in statutory disclosures is mandatory and strictly enforced. The post Wrong AGM Date in Annual Filing- MCA Imposes Penalty appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Wrong Section Mentioned in Appeal Form Not Fatal to Appeal
articles.summary: Although the assessee quoted the wrong provision in the appeal form, the challenge was clearly against a scrutiny assessment. The Tribunal ruled that procedural lapses cannot defeat a valid statutory appeal. The post Wrong Section Mentioned in Appeal Form Not Fatal to Appeal appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Penalty Imposed for Failing to Disclose Auditor Qualifications in Directors’ Report
articles.summary: The adjudicating authority held that non-disclosure of auditor-reported non-compliances violates statutory reporting duties. Monetary penalties were imposed on both the company and defaulting directors. The post Penalty Imposed for Failing to Disclose Auditor Qualifications in Directors’ Report appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Incorrect AOC-4 Filing Attracts Penalty Despite Later Correction: MCA
articles.summary: The order confirms that filing incorrect financial statements triggers penalties even if errors are later admitted and rectified. Post-filing administrative correction does not erase liability under the Companies Act. The post Incorrect AOC-4 Filing Attracts Penalty Despite Later Correction: MCA appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Section 153C Assessments Quashed for Consolidated Satisfaction Note
articles.summary: The Tribunal examined whether a single, consolidated satisfaction note for multiple assessment years meets the requirement of Section 153C. It held that such consolidated recording vitiates jurisdiction, rendering the search assessments void. The post Section 153C Assessments Quashed for Consolidated Satisfaction Note appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: IFSC Regulator Tightens Disclosure Norms for Third-Party Fund Schemes
articles.summary: The circular prescribes additional disclosures and documentation for schemes launched under third-party fund management. The move improves transparency, governance, and regulatory oversight in IFSC fund structures. The post IFSC Regulator Tightens Disclosure Norms for Third-Party Fund Schemes appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: SEBI Proposes Easier Client On-Boarding Through Centralised KYC Framework
articles.summary: The consultation paper suggests centralising supplementary KYC data at KRAs to avoid repetitive submissions. The key takeaway is improved KYC portability and faster account opening across intermediaries. The post SEBI Proposes Easier Client On-Boarding Through Centralised KYC Framework appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: SWAGAT-FI Framework Simplifies FVCI Registration and Compliance: SEBI
articles.summary: The issue concerned duplication in registration processes for foreign investors. The circular allows simultaneous FPI and FVCI registration using the same information and intermediaries. The post SWAGAT-FI Framework Simplifies FVCI Registration and Compliance: SEBI appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: 153A Additions Sustained Based on Group Search Evidence
articles.summary: The Tribunal upheld additions in search assessments where seized material and settled precedent supported the Revenue’s case. The ruling clarifies that group-level incriminating evidence can justify section 153A additions. The post 153A Additions Sustained Based on Group Search Evidence appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Defective Penalty Notice Invalidates 271(1)(c) Penalty
articles.summary: The issue was whether a penalty can survive when the show cause notice fails to specify the exact charge. ITAT held that a vague notice violates law, making the entire penalty unsustainable. The post Defective Penalty Notice Invalidates 271(1)(c) Penalty appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Deduction of tax on benefit or perquisite in respect of business or profession
articles.summary: The law taxes business/professional benefits via 10% TDS, even for non-cash perks. The key takeaway is tax must be ensured before releasing the benefit. The post Deduction of tax on benefit or perquisite in respect of business or profession appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Dealmaking via Mauritius may be a road less taken
articles.summary: The Supreme Court’s ruling against Tiger Global could reshape how foreign investors use Mauritius-based entities to invest in India. Funds must now show genuine “substance” in these jurisdictions, or face Indian tax scrutiny. The verdict may also affect other treaty-based investments and indirect share transfers in Indian companies.

articles.title: SC rules against Tiger Global: A timeline of the tax battle
articles.summary: India’s Supreme Court ruled Tiger Global must pay capital gains tax on its 2018 Flipkart exit, reshaping treaty interpretation. The court held Mauritius structures were impermissible arrangements despite certificates and prior relief. The decision overturns a Delhi High Court ruling, signalling tougher scrutiny of indirect transfers and tax avoidance in India.

articles.title: FY'27 Budget likely to peg fiscal deficit at 4.3%: ICRA
articles.summary: Union Budget News: The government is expected to set the fiscal deficit at 4.3 percent of GDP for the next financial year. Capital expenditure is projected for a significant increase. This comes as the focus shifts towards medium-term debt consolidation. The budget will also consider recommendations from the 16th Finance Commission. Market issuances are anticipated to rise sharply.

articles.title: High Court backs NHAI's move to terminate Pune co's Delhi-Mumbai expressway contract over project delay
articles.summary: The Delhi High Court’s order showed a growing judicial emphasis on timely delivery, especially for large national projects. By placing the interests of commuters and the wider economy above contractual disputes, the ruling seeks to send a clear signal that prolonged delays on critical public works will face little tolerance.

articles.title: Wanted in Budget 2026: A Trump shock absorber for the small enterprises to survive
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: The MSME sector in India, a cornerstone of economic growth and export potential, is currently navigating a stormy sea due to tariffs imposed by the US. In light of this, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget 2026 must act as a lifebuoy, offering essential measures to enhance credit flow, facilitate technological advancements, and broaden exploration of global markets.

articles.title: Printing of Budget 2026 to take place at North Block, old address of finance ministry
articles.summary: Union Budget news: Budget document printing will continue at North Block. The finance ministry team has moved to Kartavya Bhawan. Printing of confidential Budget documents will remain at the old North Block press. This exercise involves staff quarantine for up to two weeks. The halwa ceremony marks the start of this quarantine. Union Budget 2026-27 will be unveiled on February 1.

The upcoming budget is crucial for deepening domestic capabilities and scaling India as a trusted manufacturing partner.

Analysts see a bullish structure, improving macro conditions, rising institutional participation, and potential upside if key resistance levels break.

articles.title: IDBI Bank Q3 results: PAT rises 1.4% YoY to Rs 1,935 crore, NII down 24%
articles.summary: IDBI Bank reported a marginal 1.4% rise in Q3 net profit to Rs 1,935 crore year-on-year, but profit fell sharply quarter-on-quarter. Interest income and NII declined, while deposits, advances and total business recorded steady annual growth during the December quarter.

articles.title: ICICI Bank Q3 Results: PAT falls 4% YoY to Rs 11,318 crore, below estimates; NII up 7.7%
articles.summary: ICICI Bank Q3 Results: India's second largest private lender ICICI Bank on Saturday reported a 4% fall in its December quarter standalone net profit at Rs 11,318 crore compared to Rs 11,792 crore reported in the year ago period. The profit after tax (PAT) was below ET Now estimates of Rs 12,346 crore.

articles.title: 146 startups get Rs 38 crore grant under Karnataka govt's Elevate programme
articles.summary: Elevate provides a one-time grant-in-aid of up to Rs 50 lakhs to start-ups recognised under this programme. In addition, they are given mentoring and incubation support at subsidised rates at government-supported incubation centres to help in product development and validation, the Department of Electronics, IT BT said.

articles.title: California AG sends letter demanding xAI stop producing deekfake content
articles.summary: California ⁠Attorney General Robert Bonta on Friday sent ‌a ‌cease and desist ‌letter to xAI demanding the company stop the creation ​and distribution ​of AI-generated non-consensual ‌sexualised ‍imagery by ‍its Grok AI chatbot.

articles.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are in a wait-and-watch mode, awaiting clarity on tariffs and the Union Budget's capital expenditure focus. CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: US revokes over 100,000 visas so far amid Trump crackdown; deportations to continue
articles.summary: America's State Department has cancelled over 100,000 visas this year. This action targets foreign nationals with criminal records or legal issues. The department states this is to keep America safe. This move affects tourists, students, and skilled workers. Indians, a large group of visa holders, are impacted. India is raising these concerns with Washington.

articles.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. President Trump denied knowledge but criticized Powell, escalating a conflict over central bank independence and monetary policy.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: 'Mogambo Khush Hua': Kharge likens Trump to iconic villain, questions Modi’s silence

articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. Now, investors are constantly searching for a reliable crystal ball that accurately predicts the future. While no indicator is perfect, one has come closer than any other: The yield curve. A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
articles.summary: Had it not been for the hit taken by the ITC stock, the Nifty and Sensex would have ended much higher on the first trading day of 2026. Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: IEX shares slide over 4% after CERC rolls out VPPA framework
articles.summary: Shares of Indian Energy Exchange fell sharply after CERC introduced a framework for Virtual Power Purchase Agreements, raising concerns over potential impact on exchange-based power trading volumes amid broader regulatory uncertainty.

articles.title: India’s manufacturing woes: Rahul Gandhi’s prescription for job creation

articles.summary: Political sparring intensifies with a jibe at Akhilesh Yadav, while a former Trinamool leader criticizes Mamata Banerjee. International news includes NASA's diamond-planet discovery and a former child star's homelessness. Sports headlines feature Usman Khawaja's family facing abuse, and business news highlights soaring gold prices and Thailand's popularity as an Indian holiday spot.

articles.title: DGCA fines IndiGo ₹22 crore for Dec flight disruptions; airline says internal review underway
articles.summary: DGCA has imposed a ₹22.20 crore penalty on IndiGo over December 2025 flight disruptions. The airline said its board has taken cognisance of the order and an internal review is underway.

articles.title: Indonesia searching for missing surveillance plane with 11 onboard
articles.summary: The Indonesia Air Transport plane lost contact with air traffic control at about 1:30 pm (0530 GMT) around Maros region in South Sulawesi province, Andi Sultan, an official at the local rescue agency, told Reuters.

articles.title: Rossari Biotech net profit, revenue increase; Margin contracts to 11.8%

articles.title: Tiger Global case: Why tax experts fear more disputes for foreign investors
articles.summary: Himanshu Sinha, Partner – Tax Practice at Trilegal, took a sharper view, describing the Supreme Court ruling as largely unexpected and disruptive. He said the decision marks a significant shift in India’s tax treaty jurisprudence as it allows tax authorities to look past administrative assurances and reassess the commercial substance of long-standing investment structures.

articles.title: GuarantCo to deploy $300 million to back climate and infrastructure financing in India
articles.summary: GuarantCo has underwritten over $1.8 billion in guarantees since 2005, mobilising up to $7 billion in private capital for infrastructure projects in emerging markets, according to MD Nishant Kumar. The firm uses credit guarantees to reduce risk for investors and support long-term financing. Kumar said India is a key focus area, with a planned $300 million guarantee commitment to support climate projects, debt market development, and financial inclusion over the next few years.

articles.title: SC reserves judgement on father's plea seeking passive euthanasia for son in coma for over 12 years
articles.summary: The Supreme Court reserved judgment on Ashok Rana's plea for passive euthanasia for his son Harish Rana, comatose for 12 years after a 2013 fall, citing medical board reports and family hardship.

articles.title: Telecom operators seek Budget relief, propose cut in licence fees and GST waivers
articles.summary: Telecom operators have written to the Finance Ministry seeking Budget relief, including a reduction in license fees from 3% to 0.5–1% of AGR, a pause on Digital Bharat Nidhi contributions, GST waivers on regulatory payments, permission to use input tax credit for dues, and recalibration of spectrum pricing and assignment models.

articles.title: Trump threat of 25% tariff on countries doing business with Iran presents a dilemma for India

For India, this adds to existing levies, potentially raising total US tariffs on Indian goods to 75%. The move threatens a $2.33 billion trade relationship and strategic ties, such as Chabahar Port.

articles.title: Chinese Communist Party delegation meets senior BJP members at party HQ in Delhi
articles.summary: This comes as thaw in India-China ties gathers pace. In the last year, PM Modi went to China for SCO Summit, while New Delhi   Beijing have instituted many confidence building measures.

articles.title: Gujarat, Goa, Arunachal Pradesh Take Top Spots in DPIIT’s Startup Ranking
articles.summary: Gujarat was crowned the best performing startup ecosystem in the country for the fifth time in a row, as per

articles.title: From Pee Safe To EtherealX— Indian Startups Raised $269 Mn This Week
articles.summary: After weeks of lull in startup investor activity, funding momentum gathered steam in the second week of January. Indian startups

articles.title: KKR raises $2.5 billion for Asia Pacific private credit bets
articles.summary: The raise comprises $1.8 billion for KKR Asia Credit Opportunities Fund II and $700 million from separately managed accounts pursuing a similar strategy. At final close, the fund is the largest pan-regional performing private credit fund in Asia Pacific, KKR said on Wednesday.

articles.title: "May such tragedy never happen again": US Ambassador Sergio Gor pays tribute at 26/11 memorial
articles.summary: Sergio Gor, US Ambassador to India paid tributes at the 26/11 memorial at the Taj Mahal Palace Hotel in Mumbai and highlighted how under US President Trump, the alleged mastermind behind the Mumbai 2008 terror attacks- Tahawwur Rana was extradited to India.

articles.title: BMC mayor post: Why Eknath Shinde has moved his leaders in resort - number game explained
'Life-and-death election for them': Uddhav Thackeray alleges coercion, kidnapping in BMC polls; thanks voters for backing Shiv Shakti alliance
articles.summary: Shiv Sena (UBT) president Uddhav Thackeray alleged intimidation and coercion by the ruling alliance in the BMC elections, calling it a "strange" contest for political survival. Despite the Mahayuti alliance's majority, Thackeray asserted the resilience of his party, thanking voters for their support amidst alleged pressure.

articles.title: Pollution crisis: GRAP-IV reimposed in Delhi-NCR; air quality slips to ‘severe’ category
articles.summary: Delhi-NCR's air quality has plunged into the 'severe' category, prompting the Commission for Air Quality Management to reimpose GRAP-IV restrictions. This escalation follows the earlier enforcement of GRAP-III. Under Stage IV, older vehicles like BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel models are banned from plying, with exceptions for essential services. Existing GRAP measures remain in effect.

articles.title: 'Politics over peace': PM Modi slams Congress for 'neglecting' Assam; accuses it of exploiting state's challenges
Indore water contamination: Rahul Gandhi visits families of deceased
'Help them refresh': Shiv Sena shifts newly elected corporators to Bandra luxury hotel; Mahayuti eyes mayor post
articles.summary: Following a significant win in the BMC elections, Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena has housed newly elected corporators in a luxury hotel, fueling speculation about their mayoral ambitions. The BJP-Shiv Sena alliance emerged victorious, and discussions regarding the Mayor's post are underway, with a collective decision expected soon.

articles.title: Big relief for Punjab's farmers as Centre has agreed to shift border fence closer to IB: CM Mann
BMC polls setback: Congress leader demands Mumbai unit chief's resignation; gets party notice
articles.summary: Mumbai Congress faces internal turmoil after a dismal BMC election performance, its worst ever. Senior leaders are demanding city president Varsha Gaikwad's resignation, citing moral grounds. Despite the setback, party spokespersons defend the outcome, attributing it to adverse circumstances and alleged misuse of power by rivals. The party plans organizational strengthening amidst simmering dissent.

articles.title: 'People haven't rejected Ajit dada, rather ... ': Fadnavis on Pune win; hails leadership of PM Modi
Tamil Nadu polls: Congress chief Kharge chairs key meet; says it's 'equality vs bigotry'
Mamata's attack on 'agencies': Bengal CM asks CJI to protect Constitution; inaugurates Jalpaiguri circuit bench
'I'm also called Deva': Fadnavis on Uddhav Thackeray's ‘God-willing’ remark; asserts Mumbai mayor will be from Mahayuti
articles.summary: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis wittily responded to Uddhav Thackeray's mayoral aspirations, questioning if 'Deva' referred to him or God. Fadnavis asserted that the Mahayuti alliance, led by BJP and Eknath Shinde, will collectively decide the BMC mayor's selection and tenure, following their victory in the civic body elections.

articles.title: ‘Subject to judicial process’: Embassy on Indian crew detained in Iran; seeks ‘consular access’
articles.summary: India is actively engaging Iran to secure the release of 16 Indian crew members detained on the MT Valiant Roar since December. New Delhi is pressing for consular access, communication with families, and legal representation, while also ensuring the vessel's provisions. The detention follows Iran's seizure of the tanker for alleged illegal fuel transport.

articles.title: Evening news wrap: Uddhav Thackeray hits out at BJP after BMC loss; PM Modi calls for ‘Asli Poribortan’ in Bengal; & more
articles.summary: Uddhav Thackeray vowed to fight back after BMC elections, accusing BJP of betrayal. PM Modi targeted TMC in West Bengal, calling for 'asli poribortan'. India and Bangladesh U-19 captains skipped a handshake amid strained ties. PM Modi also flagged off four new Amrit Bharat Express trains.

articles.title: Beyond the badge: The unseen burden of independent Indian women
articles.summary: Modern Indian women are celebrated as independent, yet this often masks exhaustion from constant negotiation and performance. Once a thrilling discovery, independence now carries immense pressure, demanding visible strength and early responsibility. This evolution highlights a generational truth: independence is expected early, learned through observing the sacrifices of others, and often met with criticism.

articles.title: 'Your fight is our responsibility': Rahul Gandhi calls for pan-India Rohit Vemula Act; Dalit scholar died by suicide in Jan 2016
'If America embraces Indians...': US lawmakers draw sharp India–Pakistan contrast; reaffirm New Delhi as core partner
articles.summary: Senior US lawmakers emphasized India's central role in America's Indo-Pacific strategy, highlighting its importance for global stability and strong economic ties. They clarified that routine engagement with Pakistan does not signify a strategic shift, as India remains the primary focus for US investments and partnerships.

articles.title: History of India’s Union Budgets - Some Budgets that became blueprints for institutional change
articles.summary: Union Budgets are often treated as routine fiscal announcements, yet in recent four decades they have quietly reshaped taxation, regulation and economic policy. Why did finance ministers repeatedly use the Budget to dismantle the licence raj, build market institutions and enforce fiscal rules—and why does that legacy still shape India’s political economy today? The answers lie in how the Budget became a tool of structural reform.

articles.title: Trade realignment: Donald Trump tariffs push allies to hedge bets; China steps into gaps left by US
articles.summary: US President Trump's aggressive tariff strategy is prompting global trade realignments, with Canada notably cutting import taxes on Chinese electric vehicles in exchange for reduced Chinese tariffs on canola. This shift signals a growing perception in Canada that the US poses a greater economic threat than China, leading allies to seek alternatives beyond the US market.

articles.title: ICICI Bank net profit dips 4% to Rs 11,317 crore on agri provisions
HDFC Bank net profit rises 11.5% to Rs 18,653 crore on back of ltreasury profits
Bad loan recoveries help life Yes Bank Q3FY26 profits up 55% to Rs 952 crore
Big relief for EPFO members! Subscribers can now withdraw PF via UPI; rollout expected by April
Budget 2026: India's crypto sector calls for clarity and tax relief; seeks 1% TDS rationalisation
‘India makes more coaches than US, Europe’: PM Modi flags off Vande Bharat sleeper; calls it self-reliance push
Sergio Gor in India: US envoy meets RBI governor Sanjay Malhotra; talks focus on technology
'Communication lost': Indonesian aircraft with 10 on board goes missing; search under way
articles.summary: Indonesian authorities are conducting an extensive search for a turboprop aircraft that lost contact en route from Yogyakarta to Makassar. The plane was carrying three government employees from the Ministry of Marine Affairs and Fisheries and seven crew members. Search teams, including aerial assets and ground crews, are focusing on a mountainous area near the plane's last known location.

articles.title: B'desh: Journalists demand protection after attacks on national dailies; slam Yunus govt
articles.summary: Bangladesh journalists and media owners are demanding safety after violent mob attacks on major newspapers. Staff were trapped as offices were torched and looted. Concerns are mounting over press freedom and democratic institutions ahead of elections, with critics pointing to the interim government's slow response and broader issues of harassment and surveillance.

articles.title: ‘Pure comedy’: Trump's viral video leaves Internet in splits as he takes Nobel medal, forgets Laureate's name
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump's recent White House meeting with Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado, who presented him with her Nobel Peace Prize medal, has sparked widespread online ridicule. Trump's apparent inability to recall Machado's name after praising her and the prestigious award has become a viral sensation, fuelling criticism and memes about his memory and credibility.

articles.title: “Take it serious”: Kai Cenat explains why he stepped away from Twitch after record-breaking run
articles.summary: Kai Cenat has explained that his Twitch hiatus was a deliberate choice after breaking the platform’s subscriber record. Speaking to TMZ, he said the break allowed him to focus seriously on fashion and launch his clothing brand, Vivet. He also used the time to reset mentally after months of self-doubt and pressure.

articles.title: Is this even legal? Canada’s craziest football goal aced in −8°C blizzard goes viral
articles.summary: Ottawa witnessed a surreal Canadian Premier League Final as a blizzard raged, plunging temperatures to -8°C. Ground staff battled relentless snow, clearing pitch lines every 15 minutes, while players endured icy turf. This extraordinary spectacle, showcasing resilience and passion, captivated global audiences online, highlighting the growing appeal of Canadian soccer.

articles.title: Why students are choosing quick commerce gigs over internships
articles.summary: The discussion was sparked by an X post by author and market analyst Swapnil Kommawar, who shared how a friend’s brother, while pursuing a degree course, chose to work part-time as a gig worker with quick commerce platform Zepto instead of taking up an internship. The person took up the job thanks to the scarcity of paid internships and the urgent need for money to meet personal expenses, given the family’s financial constraints.

articles.title: Shadowfax set to go public amid changing logistics landscape
articles.summary: The third-party logistics (3PL) player is eyeing a valuation of Rs 7,169 crore, down from its earlier target of Rs 8,500-9,000 crore. The issue will be closely watched as the first major 3PL listing after Delhivery’s Ecom Express buy. The company follows a tech-driven and asset-light model and relies on a crowdsourced network of delivery partners compared to competitor Delhivery’s model of its own fleet of last-mile vehicles. Shadowfax, which has seen its market share rise from about 8% in FY22

articles.title: Why Elon Musk is seeking up to $134 billion from OpenAI, Microsoft in 'wrongful gains'
articles.summary: OpenAI gained between $65.5 billion and $109.4 billion from the billionaire entrepreneur's contributions when he was co-founding OpenAI from 2015, while ‌Microsoft gained ‌between $13.3 billion and $25.1 billion, Musk said in the federal court filing ahead of his trial against ‌the two companies.

articles.title: 'Can't wait to start trial': Elon Musk slams OpenAI ahead of court case; Sam Altman responds
articles.summary: Ahead of a jury trial that is set to begin in May, both sides are releasing certain documents and call notes, accusing each other of bad faith over OpenAI’s shift from a nonprofit to a for-profit model.

articles.title: Reliance’s JioMart hits 1.6 million daily orders, claims to be second-largest qcomm player in India
articles.summary: JioMart now operates across more than 5,000 pin codes, supported by over 3,000 stores in over 1,000 cities. Without disclosing exact figures, Reliance claimed that transaction frequency on its digital platforms is roughly twice that of competitors.

articles.title: Quick commerce market heats up; Blinkit drops delivery fees in select markets
articles.summary: Blinkit has cut delivery fees in select micro-markets like Gurgaon, Bengaluru and Mumbai to stay competitive against Amazon Now and Flipkart Minutes. Other quick commerce players, including Zepto and Instamart, had already reduced charges. The move aims to retain customers as rapid expansion and dark store growth intensify market competition.

articles.title: UK minister met Paramount CEO Ellison in London on Thursday, source says
articles.summary: UK culture secretary Lisa Nandy met Paramount Skydance chief David Ellison to discuss challenges facing Britain’s screen industries. The talks came amid Paramount’s intensifying bid battle with Warner Bros Discovery. The meeting followed a US court setback, highlighting the wider pressures surrounding the studio’s takeover push.

articles.title: Mother of all trade deals is loading: What it means for India
articles.summary: India and EU are on the cusp of a landmark Free Trade Agreement, potentially dubbed the 'mother of all deals.' This pact, two decades in the making, aims to boost bilateral trade and investment, offering a crucial diversification avenue amidst rising protectionism. Key sticking points include market access for automobiles and agriculture, but a breakthrough could reshape global trade.

articles.title: India's average return on FDI remains robust at 7.3%, outperforming emerging economies: CareEdge
articles.summary: India saw gross FDI inflows rise to USD 81 billion in FY25. However, increased profit repatriation and outflows significantly reduced net FDI to just USD 1 billion. Despite this, India's return on inward FDI remains strong. Emerging sectors like semiconductors and EVs are attracting foreign investment. Global FDI flows are lagging GDP growth.

articles.title: Indian Jute Mills Association seeks ban on private raw jute trading
articles.summary: The Indian Jute Mills Association has asked the government to stop private raw jute trading after March 31. This move aims to control rising prices and ensure fibre availability for mills. The association claims many mills have shut down, leaving thousands jobless. The proposal seeks to stabilize prices and secure jute bag supply for upcoming seasons.

articles.title: Budget 2026: EV incentives, step up R&D, localisation push on wishlist
articles.summary: India's upcoming Union Budget is expected to boost electric vehicle adoption. Measures will likely focus on strengthening domestic manufacturing and reducing reliance on imports. Incentives could be recalibrated to encourage investment across the EV value chain. This aims to support sustainable transport and conserve foreign exchange.

articles.title: Mother of all deals: Piyush Goyal on upcoming FTA with European Union
articles.summary: India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the proposed Free Trade Agreement with the European Union as the "mother of all deals," anticipating a mutually beneficial pact that will boost exports. He assured that national interests would not be compromised, with sensitive issues like the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism and dairy to be addressed satisfactorily.

articles.title: India’s FTA push may not offset US tariffs drag, Barclays says
articles.summary: India tariff impact: India remains one of the few major economies without a trade deal with Washington, despite facing a 50% tariff rate — among the highest in the world. The levies have dealt a heavy blow to India’s labour-intensive sectors, especially textiles, handicrafts, apparels, gems and leather.

articles.title: India-EU free trade pact will be ‘mother of all deals’, says Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: The India-EU free trade agreement is on the brink of being sealed, with negotiations nearing completion ahead of a possible announcement during an upcoming visit by EU leaders.

articles.title: India overhauls customs duty rules to help exporters and smaller businesses
articles.summary: India has updated customs rules to treat postal exports like regular cargo, simplifying incentive claims for small businesses and exporters. This change allows electronic export entries for postal shipments to be recognized for duty drawback, RoDTEP, and RoSCTL schemes. New electronic Postal Bill of Export forms have also been introduced for e-commerce and other postal shipments.

articles.title: India, Canada working to finalise scope for bilateral trade pact: Commerce Secretary
articles.summary: The two countries were earlier negotiating a trade pact but it was paused by Canada in 2023. Now they have decided to resume talks from the beginning as lot has changed on the global trade front during these two years.

articles.title: India, Israel see eye to eye on true vision for sustainable food security: Minister
articles.summary: Israel and India have signed a Letter of Intent to deepen cooperation in agriculture, fisheries, and the blue economy, aiming for sustainable food security. This expands their existing partnership to water agriculture, focusing on smart water management and innovation. The agreement underscores a shared vision and strengthens bilateral ties in these vital sectors.

articles.title: RBL Bank Q3 Results: Net profit rockets 555% to Rs 214 crore, interest income up 5% YoY
articles.summary: RBL Bank reported a 555% jump in Q3 net profit to Rs 214 crore, driven by advances growth, strong retail and wholesale lending, better asset quality, and higher deposits despite a slight dip in net interest margin.

articles.title: Dolly Khanna adds smallcap stock that has delivered 105% return in last 6 months! Do you own?
articles.summary: Dolly Khanna acquired a 1.13% stake in IFB Agro Industries following strong Q2 results and a 105% stock rally. She trimmed holdings in GHCL, Emkay, Prakash Industries, Som Distilleries, and Coffee Day Enterprises.

articles.title: Vijay Kedia adds smallcap power stock to portfolio in December quarter. Check details
articles.summary: Vijay Kedia acquired a 1.14% stake in Advait Energy Transitions, a renewable-focused Ahmedabad firm, diversifying his smallcap portfolio. Shares have fallen sharply, but Kedia also invested in Patel Engineering and increased Om Infra holdings.

articles.title: Yes Bank Q3 Results: PAT jumps 55% YoY to Rs 952 crore, NII up 11%
articles.summary: Yes Bank Q3 Results: Yes Bank on Saturday reported a 55% increase in its December quarter standalone net profit at Rs 952 crore compared to Rs 612 crore reported in the year ago period.

articles.title: Crypto market expects regulatory clarity and tax rationalisation from Budget 2026
articles.summary: Ahead of Budget 2026, India’s crypto industry is seeking regulatory clarity and tax rationalisation, especially relief from the 1% TDS and 30% flat tax, to boost liquidity, compliance, investor confidence and growth of the domestic Web3 ecosystem.

articles.title: IPO Calendar: Shadowfax among 4 IPOs worth Rs 2,066 crore to hit the market; Bharat Coking Coal to lead 7 listings
articles.summary: India’s primary market gears up for a busy week as four IPOs seek ₹2,066 crore, led by Shadowfax Technologies. Strong subscription buzz around Bharat Coking Coal and multiple listings underscore firm investor appetite entering 2026.

articles.title: Venezuelan banks will get $300 million of oil money to sell on exchange market, sources say
articles.summary: Venezuelan banks will receive 300 million dollars from oil revenues. This money comes from an account in Qatar. The banks will sell these dollars to Venezuelan companies. These companies need foreign currency to import materials. This move aims to ease a dollar shortage. The U.S. had previously seized Venezuelan oil tankers. This action impacted the country's main revenue source.

articles.title: Gold falls over 1% as profit‑taking, easing geopolitical risks weigh
articles.summary: Gold prices dropped on Friday after reaching record highs. Investors took profits as geopolitical tensions eased, reducing gold's safe-haven appeal. Despite the dip, gold is set for its second consecutive weekly gain. Silver also saw a decline after hitting an all-time high. Analysts suggest gold could still reach $5,000 this year, with corrections expected.

articles.title: Aluminium’s spectacular rally in India: What’s driving the rally above ₹320/kg and what lies ahead
articles.summary: India’s aluminium prices hit record highs in early 2026, tracking LME’s surge above $3,000/ton, driven by tight global supply, China’s capacity limits, high energy costs, tariffs, and strong Indian demand, keeping domestic premiums elevated and outlook volatile through the year.

articles.title: Torrent Pharma Raises ₹12,500 cr via Bonds for Buyout of JB Chemicals
articles.summary: Torrent Pharmaceuticals has successfully raised ₹12,500 crore through various debentures to finance its acquisition of JB Chemicals Pharmaceuticals. The funds were secured from mutual funds, insurance companies, and pension funds at yields between 7.20% and 7.80%. This strategic move aims to bolster Torrent's market position and expand its therapeutic offerings.

articles.title: RBI bans advance remittances for bullion imports in new forex rules
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has stopped advance payments for gold and silver imports. This move aims to prevent money laundering. Banks will now play a key role in monitoring all import payments. New rules also simplify trade for businesses. These changes take effect from October 1. Stricter rules will apply for future advance payments if contracts are not met.

articles.title: Reliance Industries profit flattens in Q3 on gas output, retail pressures
articles.summary: In the latest quarter, Reliance Industries reported a notable increase in profits, driven primarily by robust performances in their telecom and refining sectors. However, challenges in retail and upstream oil and gas segments put pressure on margins. On a positive note, Jio experienced remarkable growth in its digital services and home broadband offerings.

articles.title: US stocks end little changed before long weekend
articles.summary: Indian markets saw a mixed close on Friday. Major US indices ended flat for the week as earnings season began. Healthcare stocks declined, while chipmakers saw gains. Banks reported solid results, but concerns over interest rate caps pressured financial shares. Investors are now looking ahead to more earnings reports next week.

articles.title: Sebi approves separate auction session to determine closing stock prices
articles.summary: Sebi is revamping how stock closing prices are determined in India's equity cash market, moving from a 30-minute average to a new 20-minute Closing Auction Session (CAS). This move aims to enhance price discovery and transparency, aligning with global practices. Initially, CAS will apply to derivative-linked stocks, with a phased rollout starting August 3, 2026.

articles.title: ChatGPT's free ride is ending: Here's what OpenAI plans for advertising on the chatbot
articles.summary: OpenAI says it will soon start showing advertisements to ChatGPT users who aren't paying for a premium version of the chatbot. The artificial intelligence company said Friday it hasn't yet rolled out ads but will start testing them in the coming weeks.

articles.title: Spacetech startup EtherealX raises $20 million in round co-led by TDK Ventures, BIG Capital
articles.summary: Accel, Prosus, YourNest Venture Capital, BlueHill Capital, Campus Fund, and Riceberg Ventures also participated in the funding round. The maker of reusable rockets plans to fly its 35-metre-tall technology demonstrator vehicle (TDV), consisting of an eight-engine booster and an upper stage, in 2027, primarily to gather flight data, followed by the first flight of its full-scale commercial launcher, the reusable Razor Crest Mk-1, by the end of 2028, and begin commercial operations thereafter.

articles.title: Wipro Q3 profit misses estimates as one-time charges drag profit
articles.summary: Srini Pallia, CEO, Wipro: Clients are definitely looking to take costs out through vendor consolidation, and bring the efficiency and productivity through AI into the existing run and operate situations

articles.title: Tech Mahindra posts strongest December quarter in three years
articles.summary: Tech Mahindra posted its strongest quarterly performance in three years, with net profit rising 14% year-on-year to Rs 1,122 crore and revenue up 8% to Rs 14,393 crore, supported by large deal wins and core vertical growth. Margins improved for the ninth consecutive quarter, aided by operational efficiencies and AI-led initiatives. Headcount fell to 149,616 as hiring slowed.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Ties with India witness a downturn as Bangladesh navigates turbulent 2025
articles.summary: Bangladesh faced a turbulent 2025 marked by political upheaval and economic hardship. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's ouster led to strained relations with India. The nation experienced a shift towards conservatism and a rise in anti-India sentiment. Economic challenges persisted, with concerns over debt and corruption.

articles.title: 2025: A milestone in India-Singapore relations
articles.summary: India and Singapore marked 60 years of diplomatic relations in 2025. High-level visits by leaders from both nations strengthened their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. A roadmap was unveiled to deepen trade and market access. Defence cooperation saw significant engagements, including maritime exercises. Various ministerial and parliamentary delegations also exchanged visits, underscoring the robust bilateral ties.

articles.title: Tech wrap this week: Apple announces Creator Studio; Vivo, Redmi and Realme tease new products
articles.summary: From Apple’s Creator Studio launch to Google’s Veo update and new phones teased by Vivo, Redmi and Realme - here’s what changed in tech this week.

articles.title: ‘South Africa-led initiative, not institutionalised activity’: MEA clarifies why India skipped 'BRICS Naval drill'
articles.summary: In response to media queries on India skipping the BRICS Naval Exercise, MEA Spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal noted that the recently concluded naval exercise was ‘entirely a South African’ initiative.

articles.title: VinFast aims to launch 3 models, double sales outlets this year
articles.summary: VinFast India plans three new models, starting with a seven-seater MPV, and aims to double showrooms to 75 by 2026, expanding EV adoption and charging infrastructure nationwide, says Tapan Ghosh.

articles.title: RBL Bank warns of credit card slippages to continue for next two quarters
articles.summary: RBL Bank warned of continued credit card slippages in the near term, but flagged improving traction in gold loans and expects marginal NIM expansion in Q4 with stable asset quality.

articles.title: Meet Ajay Banga, Indian-origin World Bank President, named to 'Board of Peace' for Gaza
articles.summary: Ajay Banga is the 14th President of the World Bank Group. In the Gaza Peace Board, he serves alongside other global figures, including Secretary Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff, Jared Kushner, Sir Tony Blair, Marc Rowan and Robert Gabriel.

articles.title: Two women, related to gangster & jailed in murder case, win Pune civic polls
articles.summary: Sonali Vanraj Andekar and Lakshmi Udaykant Andekar are candidates of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) faction led by Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.

articles.title: Yes Bank Q3 results: Profit jumps 55% as asset quality holds steady, NII rises
articles.summary: Yes Bank reported a strong December quarter, with profit rising 55% year-on-year on higher net interest income and stable asset quality, even as deposit growth remains a sector-wide challenge.

articles.title: IREDA arm sanctions first international green energy loan for Zambia solar project
articles.summary: IREDA arm sanctions first international green energy loan for Zambia solar project

articles.title: 'Ended eight wars': Donald Trump justifies accepting Machado’s Nobel Peace Prize medal
articles.summary: Addressing reporters on the White House lawn on Friday, January 16, Trump praised the exchange as a "very nice gesture.”

articles.title: 'Sunset Clause': How Indian daters are putting time limits on love in 2026
articles.summary: In 2026, QuackQuack survey shows 37% of Indian daters use a sunset clause, setting timelines for app usage, prioritizing outcomes, compatibility, and intentional connection reviews.

articles.title: Budget 2026 | Experts call for innovation, preventive health, and policy clarity across sectors
articles.summary: Experts from crypto, healthcare, logistics, real estate, and taxation shared their expectations from the upcoming Budget, highlighting how targeted measures can unlock economic potential and improve long-term outcomes.

articles.title: Wall Street ends little changed before long weekend
articles.summary: Big US banks posted mostly solid results this week as the S P 500 reporting period got under way. Still, shares of banks and other financial institutions have been pressured by worries over US President Donald Trump's proposed one-year cap on credit card interest rates at 10%. The S P 500 financial sector, opens new tab ended up 0.1% on Friday but posted its biggest weekly percentage decline since October.

articles.title: Budget 2026 | Former World Bank advisor suggests why macroeconomic strength must translate into structural growth
articles.summary: India enters Budget 2026–27 stronger than it has been in years. Growth is steady, inflation is manageable, the external account is stable, and public finances are credible. While FY25 proved this was possible, FY26 confirmed it is repeatable, notes Davinder Sandhu, Co-Founder & Chair, Primus Partners, and Former Senior Advisor (Infrastructure) at The World Bank.

articles.title: Commerce Ministry: India-US trade talks progressing, no fixed deadline yet
articles.summary: India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement talks are “very near” conclusion, but Commerce Ministry says no deadline can be set. Exports impacted by US tariffs are being managed through diversification and FTAs.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Revamping auto PLI can unlock EV growth, says Deloitte India
articles.summary: Deloitte India has said targeted changes to the automobile PLI scheme in the upcoming Budget could ease cost pressures on EV makers, widen participation and accelerate green mobility, citing challenges around localisation norms, investment thresholds and GST structure.

articles.title: India needs inflation again: Why nominal GDP, not real growth, is the real Budget 2026 challenge
articles.summary: As India heads into Budget 2026, economists are rethinking long-held assumptions about growth and stability. With inflation at multi-decade lows and nominal GDP losing momentum, policymakers face a new challenge: reviving revenues, earnings and debt dynamics in a world where disinflation may be structural rather than cyclical.

articles.title: Fix the tax collector, not the tax rate: Dhruva Advisors' Budget 2026 pitch
articles.summary: As the finance ministry readies Budget 2026, Dhruva Advisors has urged a decisive shift towards cleaner tax administration, calling for predictable interpretations, streamlined TDS rates, and a rethink of legacy mechanisms such as TCS. The firm argues that targeted tax incentives for AI, semiconductor manufacturing, and research are essential to improve investor confidence and lift India’s long-term innovation capacity.

articles.title: Donald Trump announces 25% tariff on any country doing business with Iran effective immediately
articles.summary: The new tariff announcement also comes ahead of the Supreme Court ruling on whether or not Trump's tariffs even pass the legal framework. The Supreme Court has scheduled the next "opinion day" on Wednesday.

articles.title: 11:11 | Trump's Nobel moment; Rupee’s slide; Maharashtra civic poll results; a packed Q3 results slate & more
articles.summary: Good morning! Today’s edition of 11:11 tracks Trump's Nobel moment, the Rupee’s slide to 90.44, Counting in Maharashtra civic polls, what mutual funds bought and sold in December, China’s clampdown hitting metal prices, Infosys’ post-results rally, LTTS and Cipla downgrades, the new income-tax law implications, a packed Q3 results slate, and Anthropic’s India leadership move.

articles.title: PMC Election Results 2026: Ward-wise list of winning candidates in Pune Municipal Corp polls
articles.summary: BJP leading in 90 of 122 declared wards in PMC elections; NCP, Shiv Sena trail behind

articles.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad PCMC Election Results: BJP leads in 83 seats, NCP ahead in 37
articles.summary: The BJP is leading in 83 seats in Pimpri-Chinchwad, while Ajit Pawar's NCP is ahead in 37 seats in Pimpri-Chinchwad. Meanwhile, the Shiv Sena leads by seven seats.

articles.title: BMC Election Results 2026: Ward-wise list of winning candidates in Mumbai
articles.summary: BMC election counting shows BJP-led Mahayuti alliance leading in over 115 wards, Shiv Sena (UBT) trailing, and notable wins for Nishikant Govind Shinde and Khairunisa Akbar Husain.

articles.title: Navi Mumbai civic election results: BJP is leading in 66 seats, Shiv Sena in 42
articles.summary: As per the figures available, the BJP is ahead in 66 seats, while the Shiv Sena (Shinde) is leading in 42 seats. Shiv Sena (UBT) is leading in two seats and MNS in one

articles.title: Pune Municipal Election Results 2026: BJP leading in 90 seats; NCP ahead in 20
articles.summary: The PMC election saw a total of 1,165 candidates contesting for 165 seats. According to the latest data available, the BJP is leading in 80 wards of the civic body.

articles.title: Exit polls predict BJP–Shinde alliance sweep in Mumbai BMC elections after nine years

Thus, multiple cheques arise from one transaction will give arise to separate prosecution u/s. 138 of NI Act. The post Multiple cheques for one transaction gives rise to separate prosecution u/s. 138 of NI Act appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Partial Rejection of Books Held Invalid in Demonetisation Cash Deposit Case
articles.summary: The Tribunal clarified that the law does not permit selective or partial rejection of books under Section 145(3). In absence of specific defects, additions based on probabilities alone were set aside. The post Partial Rejection of Books Held Invalid in Demonetisation Cash Deposit Case appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Assessments Quashed for Non-Supply of Relied-Upon Material
articles.summary: The Tribunal held that assessments based on survey and requisition material are invalid when such material is not furnished to the assessee. All quantum additions were remanded for fresh adjudication after complying with principles of natural justice. The post Assessments Quashed for Non-Supply of Relied-Upon Material appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Deductor Not in Default When Payee Has Paid Due Taxes
articles.summary: The issue was whether a deductor can be treated as in default for non-deposit of TDS when the payee has already paid tax on the income. ITAT held that no demand under Section 201(1) survives once the payee’s tax payment is established. The post Deductor Not in Default When Payee Has Paid Due Taxes appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Additions Set Aside for Non-Confrontation of DVO Report
articles.summary: The Tribunal ruled that unexplained investment additions based solely on a DVO report are invalid when books are not rejected and the report is not confronted to the assessee. The matter was remanded for fresh verification following natural justice. The post Additions Set Aside for Non-Confrontation of DVO Report appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Reassessment Quashed: Pre-Merger Income Cannot Be Taxed Together
articles.summary: The issue was whether income of a predecessor company for years before amalgamation can be reassessed in the hands of the successor. ITAT held that such clubbing is impermissible and the reassessment itself is void. The post Reassessment Quashed: Pre-Merger Income Cannot Be Taxed Together appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Government Revises Part-Time Appointments to NFRA
articles.summary: The Centre has amended rules governing part-time appointments to the national financial reporting regulator. The move updates the list of senior officials nominated from key oversight institutions. The post Government Revises Part-Time Appointments to NFRA appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Tech Mahindra Q3 results: Net profit rises 14% to 1,122 crore YoY; revenue up 8%
